title: Riot is buffing domination again, because there isnt enough damage in the game.

replies.body: A little quote for you back in patch 7.4 "Ultimately, we want a player’s impact to come from the decisions they make and the actions they take in-game. Masteries supplement that power, but over time the amount of power they bring has crept up. We like the gameplay that is created by impactful Keystone masteries, but we’re looking to trim some of the invisible power from masteries which only provide passive stats."

That quote is before Runes Reforged, which combined the old Runes and Masteries system.

Then, you got your pure stats from runes, while the mastery system was more effect based.

Stop misleading people by posting something that has no relation to the current game state.

> [{quoted}](name= Król Wilk Sam,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bN1UdvBa,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-06-24T19:28:24.080+0000)
>
> That quote before Runes Reforged, which combined the old Runes and Masteries system.
> 
> Then, you got your pure stats from runes, while the mastery system was more effect based.
> 
> Stop misleading people by posting something that has no relation to the current game state.

no correlation?

yes the quote was before runes reforged... how the hell does that make a difference?

damage creep is absurd. as a player who uses the domination tree ON MY MAIN. it does NOT needs buffs.

just because your a mod doesn't mean you have to kiss riots ass.

damage NEEDS to be lowered.. there are no "IF's AND's or BUT's"

it is TOO HIGH.

and MOST of that damage creep is caused from the new masteries riot is calling "runes"
the next worst perpetrator is the item damage creep

and then  "buffing" weaker champs to become as broken as everyone else.

i like this game.. i have played it for 5 years.

and i dont give a fuck about what anyone things of my posts what mods or riots think of my posts, DAMAGE IS TOO HIGH.

riot NEEDS to know this.
and as a mod you should care about making the game good and improving it, giving riot good info keeping the forums clean from trolls... not sucking riot off when they're making shit decisions, just because they picked you.

i LOVE this game.. i do NOT want to stop playing it.. and i do NOT want riot to RUIN it or make it worse.

i CARE about this game.

and riot need CONSTRUCTIVE feedback.

they NEED people to go out and say "no, DONT DO THAT!!! the idea is horrible!!!"

and they need to see what is wrong and stop IMMEDIATELY..  not do the shit they did in season 6 with dynamic boost.

your a MOD. give riot the feedback they NEED to IMPROVE the game and make it BETTER, stop sucking up to them every time they make a bad decision.

> [{quoted}](name=SwiftKitten88,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bN1UdvBa,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2018-06-24T19:40:07.561+0000)

> damage creep is absurd. as a player who uses the domination tree ON MY MAIN. it does NOT needs buffs.

"My gold 4 adventures hold more weight then the aggregate data of literally thousands of games!"

Take your meds.

> [{quoted}](name=HekaPimp,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bN1UdvBa,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-06-24T18:55:01.808+0000)
>
> A little quote for you back in patch 7.4 "Ultimately, we want a player’s impact to come from the decisions they make and the actions they take in-game. Masteries supplement that power, but over time the amount of power they bring has crept up. We like the gameplay that is created by impactful Keystone masteries, but we’re looking to trim some of the invisible power from masteries which only provide passive stats."

this needs to be pinned

Except it's not accurate in the slightest.

It's in relation to a previous system that had different functions than the one today does.

It's irrelevant what system was in place. "We want a player’s impact to come from the decisions they make and the actions they take in-game" should hold true regardless of new runes, old runes, future runes, or win buttons. So you're saying that decisions and actions taken in-game should have less impact, and that it's okay for some lanes/games to be a foregone conclusion based on picks and runes? I haven't seen a tank in the jungle for over a month, and we're getting buffs to a tree that contains Electrocute. 

I want my impact to come from decisions and actions that I take in-game, not from bull charging into a lane and playing a 1 second match of Rock 'Em Sock 'Em Robots to see who's Electrocute procs first and wins the game.

It matters what system was in place when that quote was made because at the time it was said, there **was** a pure stat system. Or did you forget about the old runes, which was literally just free stats?

You're really failing to see the point. "Decisions and actions they take in-game" should be the ideal objective here. You saying "old system was pure stat" doesn't change that in-game play and skill should be the most significant determining factor in the outcome of a lane or a game. The amount of damage currently in the game is hindering skill expression for a flashy explosion, and decisions or actions taken in-game often times mean jack and shit. That's a problem, regardless of what system is in place.
Not sure how domination underperforms when electrocute is a must pick for like 25 champs
Because Domination's lesser masteries besides the C-tree are bleh as fuck. I almost never see it be taken as a secondary rune.

> [{quoted}](name=JPLangley,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bN1UdvBa,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2018-06-24T20:16:18.772+0000)
>
> Because Domination's lesser masteries besides the C-tree are bleh as fuck. I almost never see it be taken as a secondary rune.

Hunter runes are very good, Ravenous Hunter is + sustain for a lot of champions, especially on-hit champions and when you want to combine it with an item that provides healing (I do this on Urgot: Ravenous Hunter + Death's Dance = a lot of sustain for him) or if you already have sustain to begin with. Ultimate Hunter is good for, well, champions that rely on their ultimates. Relentless Runter is good for junglers and if you plan to roam, and Ingenious Hunter is good for supports (especially when combined with Zombie Ward) as well as mages and assassins that rely on item actives and do not need another Hunter rune more.

In fact, I pick a lot the Domination tree secondary just for the Hunter runes.

The other two non-keystone slots for runes are kinda meh, though. They could use a little more work.
"You don't have to play this game to balance it" -GhostCrawler/Meddler.
Complete butchering of the quote in every way. I agree that Riot shouldn't buff Domination's damage, but lets not take an irrelevant quote out of context, get it wrong, and half misattribute it.
How is that butchering the quote? It's legit what they both said.

It is literally not what either of them said. Go research it.

Ghostcrawler is the only one of the two who said anything even similar, but it's still far from a direct quote. His point was that understanding a game is more important than being good at it or playing it a ton when it comes to balancing it.

Everyone at Riot who works on balance (which does not include Ghostcrawler) plays the game. Most of them play it a ton, most of them are quite good at it. But far more importantly, they _understand_ it better than at least most players. No they are not perfect, far from it, but they're a lot better than most people give them credit for. It's fine to disagree with them, even about most of the changes they make, but inferring that they don't play the game is disingenuous at best.
that's why he ruined wow since late wotlk and until wod. Glad that Blizzard fired him and we got awesome addon - Legion.
Except that none of that is true. He didn't ruin anything. He wasn't fired. Legion has its ups and its down.

Ye, believe more in " resigned".

Legion had only one bad thing - random with legendaries.

He left Blizzard to come work at Riot. He talked about it publicly, saying he was going to Riot before even his last day at Blizzard. There's no legit reason to think anything different happened, take your tin foil hat off.

Legion had no flying till 7.2. Legion had heroic Coven in Antorus. Legion had Maw of Souls AP grinding. Legion had Shadow Priest dps dominance for over half of the xpac. Disc priest are still fucked in Legion. Survival was a joke for most of Legion. Tomb of Soakgaras and heroic Avatar in general. Horribly lopsided hidden appearance gating. Artifact knowledge before it was switched to just happen passively for everyone over time. The initial spawn rate of mining nodes. Mythic Xavius being the easiest mythic boss in EN. Unstable Arcanocrystal. Convergence of Fates. Mage Tower tank challenge being way harder (still, despite nerfs). Nomi research. Release necrotic affix.

And I'm sure I forgot at least 10 things. Legion was great, especially compared to WoD, but Legion was far from perfect.

>He left Blizzard to come work at Riot. He talked about it publicly, saying he was going to Riot before even his last day at >Blizzard. There's no legit reason to think anything different happened, take your tin foil hat off.

Yeah and im a rainbow pony

>Legion had no flying till 7.2.  

This is a good thing.

>Legion had heroic Coven in Antorus. Legion had Maw of Souls AP grinding.

And?  All addons have things that you will farm a lot

>Legion had Shadow Priest dps dominance for over half of the xpac

That's why people don't take you in mythic raids? Because there need to be 2 tanks 4 healers and 14 Shadow Priests? 

> Disc priest are still fucked in Legion 

So? My retribution pala suffer from addon to addon. But i still can play him in mythic raids. Who cares?

>Survival was a joke for most of Legion. 

They need time to realise what GC did to this game( as you can see same situation in lol, eksdee) but they already nerf a lot of off gcd burst spells and making them gcd in BFA.

> Tomb of Soakgaras and heroic Avatar in general. Horribly lopsided hidden appearance gating. Artifact knowledge before it was > switched to just happen passively for everyone over time

wut?

>The initial spawn rate of mining nodes

I have no problems with this. What wrong with you?

>Mythic Xavius being the easiest mythic boss in EN

So? Even our guild killed him in ~1 week.  Yes he easy but so what? This is non-tier raid.


>Mage Tower tank challenge being way harder (still, despite nerfs). Nomi research. Release necrotic affix.

This is only your problems. Not general.

>slightly.

It does underperform vs Sorcery and it does need buffs 

Also I'd rather have high cooldown Elecrocute than low cooldown Thunderlord's Decree
Laughably wrong.

Almost no meta champ in pro play currently goes Domination (even as secondary tree) tho, not Nocturne, Lucian, Zoe, Yasuo, Graves, Camille... no one. Only exceptions are Skarner for Predator, Taliyah and Vlad and sometimes Galio out of like 50 champs.

So, the abusers of Electrocute aren't meta?

Zed, who is currently pick/ban, is out of meta?

Talon, who is a good choice across from Zed, is out of meta?

LeBlanc, who has recently come back into the spotlight after her revert, is out of meta?

Annie? Fizz? Ahri? Kayn? Lee Sin? Renekton? TF? Vel'Koz? Wukong? Urgot?

You can argue that half of these champs don't see pro play, but half of them do.

Meanwhile mages, who have the same keystone twice in Comet and Aery, Phase Rush, and access to Nimbus Cloak - the alternative to Ultimate Hat which was deemed "too strong for Sorcery" and moved _into_ Domination - which, as an immobile mage who for the most part has to root themself in place to cast their ult, is USELESS.

But yeah, Sorcery is way too strong. It's overperforming.

Zed has 60% ban rate in lower elos and below 30% in Diamond currently. That tells me enough tbh lel. Same for Fizz, almost 30% in "low elo", below 9% in Diamond. 

>You can argue that half of these champs don't see pro play, but half of them do.

LB was picked once this patch and lost in an academy game, Kayn went Conqueror/Resolve, so did Renek most of the time, TF, Urgot, and Vel also dont go Domination. So yeah, kinda underperforming in pro play at least, which is usually where to best stuff is picked.

Pros don't pick what's "best," however that can be defined; they pick what's _safest._

Why did Riot introduce tower first blood and get rid of Bot Tower's shield? Because they didn't want The Pros abandoning bot lane to push mid and then deathball at top when they had an unfavourable lane matchup.

Why do they keep pushing damage? Because they think that it'll make The Pros play riskier. Because, you know, punishing assumption of risk totally makes risk more attractive.

Why did they rework the Mage Item Tree and then immediately nerf Seraph? Because it was the safest option because it gave scaling damage _and_ a shield.

Pros don't pick Zed and Leblanc and Fizz _right now_ because they're not safe, and they require time and a little bit of setup. They pick Camille and Sion with Comet and Taric/Yi or Nunu/Karthus, because they are safe picks that require little effort to succeed and a lot of effort to stop.

Keep in mind that Faker was a Zed _main_ 3 seasons ago, even in LCS.

and the _reason_ they play safe now is because damage is too high,
 a single mistake will get you killed in an instant and can cost your team the game

Well if pros pick whats safest, isnt that also kinda the best? Of course there is always a skill difference and Talon is really good in soloq rn, but.. Id still say the "best" is whats played in pro play, so Zoe, Swain, Irelia,... 
And at least in pro play, no champ really takes Domination. The question is if that justifies buffing it. But.. I mean... Regardless, its literally getting +1 AD and +1-2 AP, thats it so far lol.

> LeBlanc, who has recently come back into the spotlight after her revert, is out of meta?

Revert was an immense nerf, bigger the nerf the more skilled le blanc you were
Statistics dont lie, 

> Annie? Fizz? Ahri? Kayn? Lee Sin? Renekton? TF? Vel'Koz? Wukong? Urgot?

Renekton USES press the attack
Lee sin playerbase just wants ward hops back
Velkoz hasnt been relevant ever in this game. Not to shocked on this as soon as I SAW the spotlight I though to myself look garbage syndra 2.0 but has tentacles
Electrocute Renekton OMEGALUL

I don't mean to say "Domination on a lot of champions with dashes and combos isn't very good", it is!

The Domination tree has one very good rune in each row (Electrocute, Sudden Impact, Eyeball Collection, Untimate hunter) if your champion uses those four well, the domination tree is a real blast for you 

Otherwise it's geniune garbage tier, imagine taking dark harvest on Syndra with cheap shot, ghost poro and Ravenous hunter...

?
Why does it need buffs any not Socery need nerfs?

Parts of the domination tree needs buffs, imagine if every non keystone rune was as bad as ghost poro?

Aery already got nerfed and so did comet, ultimate hat was swapped for nimbus cloak, manaflow band got changed from "free spell" to "mini tear", celerity recently got put into the dumpster for any champ which can't get a speed boost, I think the last row is untouched but sorcery has gotten a fair amount of nerfs

I see as much electrocute these days   as  comet+aery at the start of the season, but yeah its underperforming so hard.  Meanwhile sorcery and inspiration users  are looking for a rope and a suitable place to use it...

{{champion:238}} hahahahahahah

Yes seriously, riot thought that putting more damage into the game would let low brained people get well with those champs...

Zed missing all skillshots > yet all he needs to do is R>1 AA for electro proc + duskblade and im dead. Yeah, this is made for newbies so that they can say ''omg im good at zed!''

I think the bigger issue is that all the other trees just offer more.. Champion's don't need the extra damage in Domination, so they can take other trees and not have much of a trade off... This is coming from someone who plays Rengar almost exclusively and favors FF.
i read "dominion" and was hyped ;(

Riot: We're trying to equalize with sorcery

Gameplay: ThEY're raiSINg daMaGE In THe gAME
You see precisions and sorc more than domination, it's just dom is mandatory on certain champs. It is worse than sorc and precision, but resolve is in an even worse state atm (and its users)
Don't forget with ultimate hunter and zombie ward supports and other people pick it as well.
50 base damage keystone at level 1 btw
Still wait a really BIG nerf to AD assassin and maybe the game can be enjoyable to play again. All know they are juts unhealy as hell for the game.

Switched to elecrocute with Lux...and It is  SO MUCH better than the weak sorcery tree. The harass from comet is laughable and can be dodged too. With Elecrocute i can stand trades with  champs like Zed. At lv1 E+2 autos and he's 50% hp. Why should i use comet?xD

"Domination underperforming"
REEEEEE BUFFING DOMINATION BY 1 AD SO IT MATCHES THE SORCERY BONUSES REEEEEEE

Lol riot will keep power creeping the game regardless of almost every single player telling them not to, and telling them that they don’t like it.

People have been complaining about weak towers for a year... Rito: buffs baron minions, weakens nexus towers, buffs rift herald, adds rune for one shotting towers, makes mages capable of two shotting towers, continuously buffs damage accross the board.......

They made ONE good change, when they buffed baron, but they quickly jumped to “fix” that by gutting barons damage.

The balance team is retarded. Hashinshin is NOT over exaggerating !

These people really need to get new jobs answering phones or something. How about this, give domination half of the runes in sorcery  that are for **conditional movement speed** and rework the whole sorcery tree into something useful. So bored with riot's AD knob gobbling.

Okay, here are the masteries that are good in Domination:

- Thunderlord's Decree (K-1)
- Predator (K-2)
- Sudden Impact (A-3)
- Zombie Ward (B-1)
- Ravenous Hunter (C-1)
- Ingenious Hunter (C-2)
- Relentless Hunter (C-3)
- The Ultimate Hunter (C-4)

So out of of 14 masteries in the Domination tree, only 8 of them are unquestionably good. And 4 of them are in the same column. Sorcery's A-tree diversity got cucked because Ultimate Hat was moved to Domination's C-tree while only getting Nimbus Cloak in compensation.
